content.content: In September, a small working group formed to focus on medium-term initiatives that further develop MakerDAO as an autonomous organization. Since then, the group has added @SamM to the working group and updated a few objectives:  Decentralize Domain Teams’ work. Secure income from the Maker Protocol to ensure funding of continued operations. Maintain and develop Maker Governance integrity. Attract, onboard, and develop domain teams and individual actors working for the DAO. Map a DAO operating infrastructure.  Current Progress The progress of the work on the objectives are tracked in this document. Some key highlights in the past 2 months:  Set New Rate Structure and Working Group for Stability Fees Further development of Protocol payouts through Keg/Flapper Distributor  Defined onboarding new Operational Support domain and domain facilitators Drafted MIP13 for funding SourceCred from the Protocol Developed Onboarding Real World Assets Working Group Developed the Collateral Framework for tracking and prioritizing assets Launched Risk Monitoring Tools Grants   What’s Next?  Initiatives for onboarding more contributors Developing a MIPs Portal Improvements to the governance experience Get domain teams and contributors paid by the protocol using MIP14 Operating structure for individuals and teams working for the DAO Building a DAO Roadmap  – @hexonaut @Primoz @SebVentures @LongForWisdom @amyjung @juanjuan
content.GPT-summary: The post provides an update on the progress of a working group that was formed to develop MakerDAO as an autonomous organization. The post explains the objectives of the group and highlights some key achievements in the past two months. The post also outlines some future initiatives and invites contributors to collaborate.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal

content.content: This is awesome! I’m curious if I’d be any help to the working group. The team is clearly miles ahead of my understanding of the coding and technical implications, but as a writer with some management experience I imagine I might be able to lighten some of the administrative work in order to help you all focus on all the technical hurdles. No worries if there’s no fit for me yet, I plan to be around for the long haul and my DMs are always open. Cheers, and thanks again for all the time and effort you all have put in!
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party offering to collaborate on proposal
3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: I just requested access to the progress document and would be interested in supporting the work of this team.
If you’re both on rocket chat message me your handles (@LongForWisdom) and I’ll add you to the group chat and docs. I’m sure we can find something useful for you to do.
